sub_title: Masters student—TU Delft—Transportation Infrastructure Logistics (TIL) program
summary: Multilingual, multicultural civil engineer passionate about all things transportation, in particular transit operations, high speed rail, and bicycle infrastructure. Interested in gaining engineering and analytical experience in all things transportation, especially public transit.

certifications.name: PE
certifications.authority: California Board of Land Surveyors and Engineers

profile_positions.description:
	COVID-19 Department Operations Center—lead engineer/planner for all transportation considerations for the city between March 2020 to the present. Coordinated across various city agencies to setup rapid response to transit route changes, temporary street closures or lane closures for vaccine, testing, or food bank setups, and create the Transportation Recovery Plan (TRP). The TRP consists of temporary emergency transit lanes (TETLs), transit service planning, outdoor dining program (Shared Spaces), and streets closed to thru traffic (Slow Streets). Worked with executive staff, members of the public, and partner agencies to quickly implement the programs in the TRP. 
	project engineer/lead designer aiding in the project approvals, final design, and project coordination for the Better Market Street project. Project is currently in the final design process after being value engineered due to the COVID-19 pandemic and changing travel patterns. Project located between Steuart and Octavia streets and comprises of rebuilding Market Street curb lanes, improving water catch-basins and general water flow along curbs, center track lanes, upgrading the overhead catenary system (OCS), improving bicycle and pedestrian safety, and replacing 23 traffic signals. Collaboration with over 10 designers on the team to complete the project, specs, and cost estimates and advertise the contract for a section of the overall project. Expected project construction & cost: 2022 and $600M
	direct supervisor of an assistant engineer that is currently working on The Active Beale project, which is a multimodal project that will construct a sidewalk-level two-way protected bikeway and has already constructed a quick-build version of the bikeway and a Muni only lane connecting the new Salesforce transit center with Market Street, and The 12 Rincon Hill Muni reroute project.
profile_positions.title: Associate Engineer

profile_positions.description:
	project engineer for the 10-Sansome contraflow lane extension. Project converts a one-way street into a two-way street for buses along a three-block stretch of Sansome Street. Performed site analysis, analyzed water flow drainage for proper curb ramp layouts & roadway drainage, developed proposals using AutoCAD, completed outreach to the community and the Jackson Square merchants association, and completed legislation for the project. Worked with contractor to ensure a good quality product that followed all specifications. Project completed under budget although slightly delayed to accommodate for Super Bowl 50 celebrations. Project benefits: 3 minute time savings for two bus routes, improved drainage and water flow along curbs, improved safety due to new, updated traffic signals, and more logical parking configuration for shoppers, businesses, and residents. 
	project engineer/lead designer aiding in the conceptual design, preliminary engineering, and project coordination for the Better Market Street project. Project located between Steuart and Octavia streets and comprises of rebuilding Market Street sidewalks, curb lanes, center track lanes, upgrading the OCS system, creating a protected-raised cycle track, replacing 23 traffic signals, addressing access/loading issues, and upgrading the historic path of gold. This phase of the project involved managing consultants for drawings and CEQA/NEPA write-ups leading to the final EIS and EIR products.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Engineer

profile_positions.description:
	project engineer for a Vision Zero project to restrict private auto access to Market Street between 8th and 3rd streets. Project included extension of the current center lane bus/taxi only lanes, painted bulbs at five locations, additional passenger loading and blue zones along streets tangent to Market Street. 
	delay studies: T line to evaluate limited implemented LRV preemption along 3rd St and N line to collect pre-construction travel times. Extensive use of MS office products were used in order to complete the analysis and data scrubbing.
profile_positions.title: Junior Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Projects included:
	site condition analysis of the 14-Mission, L-Taraval, N-Judah lines for Travel Time Reduction Proposals (TTRP) for the Transit Effectiveness Project (TEP). Solutions include transit bulbs, bulb outs, Transit Signal Priority (TSP), queue jumps, bus lanes, stop consolidation, and boarding island extensions. AutoCAD to design schematics for different TTRP's, including 2D and 3D modeling.   
	traffic counts at Mission/6th and Market/6th for proposed removal of a tow-away lane. 
	parking turnover study for community outreach related to 4 proposed transit bulbs.
	delay studies: T line to evaluate proposed signal timing plans (100s cycle, 120s cycle, running free) and F line along the Embarcadero to input TSP parameters for remote detection to complement local detection.
	field survey of Opticom receivers at signal controllers along Mission St and Geary Blvd to guarantee TSP performance. Adjustment of timing cards to accommodate 3.5ft/s pedestrian walking speed and future TSP.
	 engineering and legislation for the establishment of a 78’ bus zone. 
	Parking turnover study for a new residential permit parking area in Alamo Square neighborhood.
profile_positions.title: 5381 Civil Engineer Intern-Design Trainee 2

profile_positions.description: cashier duties, customer service, security, night audit duties, reservations, barista, concierge services, training of new staff.
profile_positions.title: Front Desk Receptionist

profile_positions.description: Helped supervisor manage frequent traveler card renewal program. Promotion and marketing of group visits of the Lyon St Exupery airport.  Toured the airport operations in the airport safety vehicle and assisted in wildlife control on the runways.
profile_positions.title: Office Assistant
